snippet: The senior allied commander in Afghanistan acted in response to a NATO attack in the eastern part of the country last week that Afghan officials say killed 18 civilians.
abstract: Gen John R Allen, top allied commander in Afghanistan, orders new restrictions on airstrikes against Taliban fighters who hide in residential homes, underscoring NATO's existing commitment to protecting civilians; move comes after Afghan officials announced that 18 civilians, including 9 children, were killed in recent airstrike.
lead_paragraph: The senior allied commander in Afghanistan acted in response to a NATO attack in the eastern part of the country last week that Afghan officials say killed 18 civilians.
